captions.text: Today is going to be all about finishing.
About scoring goals, but to score goals you need quality.
So you need good quality build up, if it comes out wide, you need to get the ball out of your feet,
you need to get your crossing.
We went into a crossing and finishing drill, which was a first time cross or a cross on the overlap,
We looked at the timings of the runs into the box and the movement of players once they are in the box.
Whormsey, you do not need to find the man. You need to put the ball in behind Darren so that James can’t come and get it,
At the back post, or at the near post.
We did it unopposed as well today because I wanted to the players to feel the ball, as I say, hitting the back of the net,
to feel different surfaces, to score with different surfaces: head volley, front foot, side foot, that kind of thing.
Go and meet the ball! Good, set! Finish, head it! Good.
The people delivering the ball will need to have a better idea of where the players are going,
and deliver into a better area.
